titles.ar: بَابُ الْمُحْرِمِ يُغَطِّي رَأْسَهُ أَوْ وَجْهَهُ مُتَعَمِّداً أَوْ نَاسِياً
titles.en: Chapter 89 – The one in Ihraam covers his head or his face deliberately, or out of forgetfulness
Chapter 90 – The shade for the one in Ihraam

titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّجُلِ يُحْرِمُ فِي قَمِيصٍ أَوْ يَلْبَسُهُ بَعْدَ مَا يُحْرِمُ
titles.en: Chapter 88 – The man wear Ihraam in a shirt, or he wears it after wearing Ihraam

titles.ar: بَابُ الْمُحْرِمِ يُغَطِّي رَأْسَهُ أَوْ وَجْهَهُ مُتَعَمِّداً أَوْ نَاسِياً
titles.en: Chapter 89 – The one in Ihraam covers his head or his face deliberately, or out of forgetfulness

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/299)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ ابْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ الْمُحْرِمُ يُؤْذِيهِ الذُّبَابُ حِينَ يُرِيدُ النَّوْمَ يُغَطِّي وَجْهَهُ قَالَ نَعَمْ وَ لَا يُخَمِّرْ رَأْسَهُ وَ الْمَرْأَةُ عِنْدَ النَّوْمِ لَا بَأْسَ بِأَنْ تُغَطِّيَ وَجْهَهَا كُلَّهُ عِنْدَ النَّوْمِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, and Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Ibn Raib, from Zurara,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’farasws, said, ‘I said, ‘The one in Ihraam is pestered by the flies when he intends to sleep, Can he cover his face?’ Heasws said: ‘Yes, but he cannot conceal his head; and the woman during sleep, there is no problem if she covers her face, all of it, during the sleep’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from ibn Mahbub from ibn Ri’ab from Zurarah who has said the following: “I once asked abu Ja’far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who covers his face when sleeping because of flies that bother him. He (the Imam) said, ’Yes, he can do so, but must not cover his head; and women are permitted to cover their faces when they sleep.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/300)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ الْقُمِّيِّ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الْمُحْرِمُ يَتَوَضَّأُ ثُمَّ يُجَلِّلُ وَجْهَهُ بِالْمِنْدِيلِ يُخَمِّرُهُ كُلَّهُ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Sinan, from Abdul Malik Al Qummy who said,
‘I said to Abu Abdullahasws, ‘The one in Ihraam performs ablution, then he wipes his face with the towel concealing all of it’. Heasws said: ‘There is no problem’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Sinan from ‘Abd al-Malik al-Qummiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who takes wudu’ and then wipes his face with a handkerchief that covers all of it. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/300)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْمُحْرِمِ يَنَامُ عَلَى وَجْهِهِ عَلَى زَامِلَتِهِ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws, said, ‘I asked himasws about the one in Ihraam sleeping upon his face on his wrapping’. Heasws said: ‘There is no problem with it’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘ Urn ay r from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who in the state of Ihram sleeps with a Zamilah (wrapping) on his face. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/300)

narrator_chain.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْمُحْرِمِ يَجِدُ الْبَرْدَ فِي أُذُنَيْهِ يُغَطِّيهِمَا قَالَ لَا .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan, from Abdul Rahman who said,
‘I asked Abu Al Hassanasws about the one in Ihraam feeling the cold in his ears, can he cover them both?’ Heasws said: ‘No’.
en.sarwar: 4. Abu Ali al-Ash’ariy has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan from ‘Abd al-Rahman who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who because of cold covers his ears while in the state of Ihram. He (the Imam) said, ‘No, he must not do so.’”
